member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientApplication
member.summary: Information about the client application that invoked the Lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientApplication.AppPackageName
member.summary: The application's package name.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientApplication.AppTitle
member.summary: The application's title.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientApplication.AppVersionCode
member.summary: The application's version code.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientApplication.AppVersionName
member.summary: The application's version.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientApplication.InstallationId
member.summary: The application's installation id.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientContext
member.summary: Information about client configuration and execution environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientContext.Environment
member.summary: Environment information provided by mobile SDK.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientContext.Client
member.summary: The client information provided by the AWS Mobile SDK.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.IClientContext.Custom
member.summary: Custom values set by the client application.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ICognitoIdentity
member.summary: Information related to Amazon Congnito identities.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ICognitoIdentity.IdentityId
member.summary: The Amazon Cognito identity ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ICognitoIdentity.IdentityPoolId
member.summary: The Amazon Cognito identity pool ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext
member.summary: Object that allows you to access useful information available within the Lambda execution environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.AwsRequestId
member.summary: The AWS request ID associated with the request. This is the same ID returned to the client that called invoke(). This ID is reused for retries on the same request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.ClientContext
member.summary: Information about the client application and device when invoked through the AWS Mobile SDK. It can be null. Client context provides client information such as client ID, application title, version name, version code, and the application package name.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.FunctionName
member.summary: Name of the Lambda function that is running.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.FunctionVersion
member.summary: The Lambda function version that is executing. If an alias is used to invoke the function, then this will be the version the alias points to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.Identity
member.summary: Information about the Amazon Cognito identity provider when invoked through the AWS Mobile SDK. Can be null.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.InvokedFunctionArn
member.summary: The ARN used to invoke this function. It can be function ARN or alias ARN. An unqualified ARN executes the $LATEST version and aliases execute the function version they are pointing to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.Logger
member.summary: Lambda logger associated with the Context object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.LogGroupName
member.summary: The CloudWatch log group name associated with the invoked function. It can be null if the IAM user provided does not have permission for CloudWatch actions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.LogStreamName
member.summary: The CloudWatch log stream name for this function execution. It can be null if the IAM user provided does not have permission for CloudWatch actions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.MemoryLimitInMB
member.summary: Memory limit, in MB, you configured for the Lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaContext.RemainingTime
member.summary: Remaining execution time till the function will be terminated. At the time you create the Lambda function you set maximum time limit, at which time AWS Lambda will terminate the function execution. Information about the remaining time of function execution can be used to specify function behavior when nearing the timeout.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaLogger
member.summary: Lambda runtime logger.

member.name: M:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaLogger.Log(System.String)
member.summary:
Logs a message to AWS CloudWatch Logs.
Logging will not be done: If the role provided to the function does not have sufficient permissions.

member.name: M:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaLogger.LogLine(System.String)
member.summary:
Logs a message, followed by the current line terminator, to AWS CloudWatch Logs.
Logging will not be done: If the role provided to the function does not have sufficient permissions.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaSerializer
member.summary: Interface that must be implemented by custom serializers that may need to be called during execution.

member.name: M:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaSerializer.Deserialize``1(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: This method is called to deserialize the request payload from Invoke API into the object that is passed to the Lambda function handler.
member.typeparam: Type of object to deserialize to.

member.name: M:Amazon.Lambda.Core.ILambdaSerializer.Serialize``1(``0,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: This method is called to serialize the result returned from a Lambda function handler into the response payload that is returned by the Invoke API.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.Core.LambdaLogger
member.summary: Static class which sends a message to AWS CloudWatch Logs. When used outside of a Lambda environment, logs are written to Console.Out.

member.name: M:Amazon.Lambda.Core.LambdaLogger.Log(System.String)
member.summary:
Logs a message to AWS CloudWatch Logs.
Logging will not be done: If the role provided to the function does not have sufficient permissions.

member.name: T:Amazon.Lambda.Core.LambdaSerializerAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute is required for serialization of input/output parameters of a Lambda function if your Lambda function uses types other than string or System.IO.Stream as input/output parameters.
This attribute can be applied to a method (serializer used for method input and output), or to an assembly (serializer used for all methods).

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.Core.LambdaSerializerAttribute.SerializerType
member.summary: Type of the serializer. The custom serializer must implement Amazon.Lambda.ILambdaSerializer interface, or an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Amazon.Lambda.Core.LambdaSerializerAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs attribute with a specific serializer type.
